content:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/blob/master/text/1214-projections-lifetimes-and-wf.md
contains this inference rule

OutlivesReference:
  R ⊢ 'x: 'a
  R ⊢ T: 'a
  --------------------------------------------------
  R ⊢ &'x T: 'a

why isn't T: 'x in the premises, then? isn't that necessary for &'x T to be well-formed?
